text.section: No claimant shall be entitled to an oral hearing as a matter of right; but the administrator may in his discretion order a hearing in any case presenting unusual circumstances, or where it appears that documentary evidence of any material fact cannot reasonably be obtained, or where the claim cannot otherwise adequately be determined. If a hearing is ordered, it shall be conducted in accordance with KRS Chapter 13B. The administrator may investigate any matter which in his judgment is not adequately proven, or which shows or raises an inference of fraud, and may require submission of supplementary proof.

law.history: Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 318, sec. 25, effective July 15, 1996. -- Created 1960 Ky. Acts ch. 15, sec. 8, effective February 20, 1960.
